topic_or_construct: Attitude toward discussing organ donation wishes
measured_by: 2-item TPB attitude measure ('It would be valuable for me to… tell my family my donation preference')
justification: "TPB constructs were assessed with 2-item measures of attitude ("It would be valuable for me to…") … scored 1 strongly disagree to 5 strongly agree."

topic_or_construct: Self-efficacy for discussing organ donation wishes
measured_by: 2-item TPB self-efficacy measure ('It would be easy for me to… tell my family my donation preference')
justification: The Methods section states: "TPB constructs were assessed with 2-item measures of … self-efficacy ("It would be easy for me to …")…"

topic_or_construct: Subjective norm about discussing donation wishes
measured_by: 2-item TPB subjective-norm measure ('People who are important to me think I should… tell my family my donation preference')
justification: Same paragraph notes a "2-item measure of subjective norm ("People who are important to me think I should …")" for the discussion behaviour.

measured_by: 3-item TPB intention measure ('I intend to… tell my family my donation preference')
justification: The authors report a "3-item measure of intention ("I intend to …")" ending with the behaviour description.

topic_or_construct: Past family discussion of donation wishes
measured_by: Single-item question 'Have you told your partner or a family member about your preference for organ donation?'
justification: Under Past behaviour: "Prior family discussion about donation wishes was measured with 'have you told your partner or a family member about your preference for organ donation?' (yes, no, unsure)."

measured_by: 1-item statement 'The idea of organ donation disgusts me'
justification: Cognitive-affective variables: "Disgust ("the idea of organ donation disgusts me") … were each measured with one item."

measured_by: 1-item statement 'My body should be kept whole for burial'
justification: The same sentence lists bodily integrity measured by one item: "bodily integrity ("my body should be kept whole for burial")".

measured_by: 1-item statement 'I trust that doctors and hospitals use donated organs as they are intended to be used'
justification: Methods: "medical mistrust ("I trust that doctors and hospitals use donated organs as they are intended to be used") … were each measured with one item."

topic_or_construct: Fear of not really being dead
measured_by: 1-item statement 'I am scared that I would not really be dead if I am a donor and my organs are taken for transplantation'
justification: The list continues: "fear of not being dead ("I am scared that I would not really be dead if I am a donor and my organs are taken for transplantation") were each measured with one item."

measured_by: Adapted 8-item Index of Dental Anxiety and Fear (IDAF-4C+)
justification: "We adapted the 8-item Index of Dental Anxiety and Fear to measure anxiety about discussing donation wishes with family."
"The 10-item FACESIV Family Communication scale was used to measure whether participants perceived they had healthy communication… with family members."

measured_by: Single-item question 'In the past fortnight, did you tell your family your donation preference?'
justification: Time 2 Measures: "Discussion behaviour was measured with the item, 'In the past fortnight, did you tell your family your donation preference' (yes, no)."

measured_by: Single-item rating 'Overall, how would you rate your knowledge of organ donation'
justification: Experience measures: "Self-rated knowledge about donation ("Overall, how would you rate your knowledge of organ donation", excellent to very poor) … were assessed using 1-item measures."
